main event: A round, white object the size of a second magnitude star was observed in the sky over Albuquerque, New Mexico for approximately 25 minutes.
interesting points: The object was described as a steady white light with no discernible features.
The motion of the object was slow and consistent with a balloon, but the duration of the sighting ruled out a balloon.
The sighting was observed by three reliable witnesses, including a physicist from the Air Force Weapons Laboratory.
Weather conditions at the time of the sighting were clear with good visibility.
The Air Force Safety Officer was unable to evaluate the phenomena.
sighted object: a round, white object similar to a second magnitude star
